outline:
1. perpetuity, for ever, continuing future
    1. ancient (of past time)
    2. for ever (of future time)
      1. of continuous existence
    3. for ever (of God's existence)
kjv_def: eternity, ever(-lasting, -more), old, perpetually, [phrase] world without end.
strongs_def: properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
